problems.title: Oculus Home won't install
problems.solution:
Please provide your system specifications (CPU and GPU, as well as free space) as well as a log file you can locate information on [here](https://support.oculus.com/articles/fix-a-problem/troubleshooting-rift-s/collect-logs-for-rift/).
 This will help whoever has the time to help you.

embed.title: Update or install stuck
embed.description:
There are two possible fixes if a restart does not resolve this. 
 
 You can [factory reset](https://support.oculus.com/articles/fix-a-problem/troubleshoot-headsets-and-accessories/troubleshooting-factory-reset-quest-2/) your Quest. 

 Alternatively, if you have [SideQuest](https://sidequestvr.com/setup-howto), you can go into 'My Apps', find the app called 'com.oculus.ocms', go into Settings, and hit 'Clear app data'. 

 You can find a quick video showing this in SideQuest [here](https://youtu.be/99WL1gHPVcg).

embed.title: AirLink Performance Issues
embed.description: If you are having Air Link issues please follow the tips below.

fields.name: Improve latency
fields.value:
Make sure your computer is wired via Ethernet into the router. Ideally the Quest should obtain Wi-Fi from the same device your computer is wired to.

 Make sure you are using 5Ghz AC or AX WiFi. Wi-Fi Hotspots from computers don’t perform well and should be avoided.

 Make sure you aren't too far away from your router and/or have no obstacles/walls in between

Create separate SSIDs (wireless network names) for your wireless bands (2.4Ghz and 5Ghz) and connect the Quest solely to the 5Ghz (with no other devices). 

 Use a wireless survey tool (the Android app WifiAnalyzer (Open Source) is recommended) to make sure your router is the only nearby router on its channel. Try not to overlap channels, co channel interference is better than adjacent.

fields.name: Improve Performance
fields.value:
Make sure your settings are not turned up too high, you can adjust this by going into Oculus Home and checking the following 
 
 1. Click 'Devices' and click your Quest
 2. Click the graphics options. 
 3. Set it to 72hz at 1.0x to see if this helps.

fields.name: Still having issues
fields.value:
Please post your computer specs, including CPU and GPU. 
 Please also mention if your computer is **wired** to your router or not. 

 The more information you can provide, the more likely someone can assist with you

embed.title: Virtual Desktop Performance Issues
embed.description: If you are having issues with Virtual Desktop please follow the below guide to optimize your setup.

fields.name: Improve latency
fields.value:
Make sure your computer is wired via Ethernet into the router. Ideally the Quest should obtain Wi-Fi from the same device your computer is wired to.

 Make sure you are using 5Ghz AC or AX WiFi. Wi-Fi Hotspots from computers don’t perform well and should be avoided.

 Make sure you aren't too far away from your router and/or have no obstacles/walls in between

Create separate SSIDs (wireless network names) for your wireless bands (2.4Ghz and 5Ghz) and connect the Quest solely to the 5Ghz (with no other devices). 

 Use a wireless survey tool (the Android app WifiAnalyzer (Open Source) is recommended) to make sure your router is the only nearby router on its channel. Try not to overlap channels, co channel interference is better than adjacent.

fields.name: Still having issues
fields.value:
Please post your overlay, you can do that by following the below instructions

1.) Go into the Settings tab in the Virtual Desktop menu in VR and make sure copy 'screenshots to desktop' is enabled.
2.) Go into the Streaming tab and check 'Show performance overlay'.
3.) Launch your VR game.
 4.) Look for numbers that are turning orange.
 5.) When you see this, hold right Oculus button + press right or left trigger to take a screenshot.

The screenshot will be found on your desktop and you can share it here.

problems.select_title: Quest not prompting for file access

embed.title: Quest not prompting for file access
embed.description: Make sure Developer Mode is turned off in the mobile application, otherwise please note what kind of cable you are using below, as well as any adapters.

problems.select_title: Oculus Link cable showing as USB 2.0

embed.title: Cable Issues
embed.description:
Link cable issues are typically indictive of either a failing cable, or, if it never worked as 3.0, a faulty or misadvertised cable. 
 
 Assuming you bought a USB 3.0 cable, the best option you have is to try another port. 
 
 If that doesn't work, please post the cable you have below and mention that you still need help.

embed.title: 3 Dots
embed.description: The '3 dots' issue on Link is generally caused by only a few things; please look at the below sections depending on if you are on a desktop or laptop

fields.name: Desktop
fields.value:
If you have a desktop that meets minimum specs, or it has worked previously, the 3 dots issue on a desktop computer is usually related to GPU drivers.

 Please try to update your graphics card driver.
 If that doesn't work, try Air Link to see if you have the same issue on Air Link to rule out driver issues. 
 If it works on Air Link, the problem is likely associated with USB.

fields.name: Laptop
fields.value:
If you have a laptop that meets minimum specs, or it has worked previously, the 3 dots issue on a laptop is usually related to either drivers or Link trying to run on the integrated GPU. 

 Please try forcing Oculus to run on the correct GPU by doing the following: 
 1. Open 'Graphics Settings' by opening Start and searching for it. 
 2. Add the following three items to the list: 
 
 OVRRedir.exe
 OculusDash.exe
 OVRServer_X64.exe

 All three files will be located in the Oculus folder.

embed.title: Applications are missing
embed.description:
If all of the applications on your Quest are missing, just try these simple instructions:

 1. Navigate to https://secure.oculus.com/my/security/, hit edit on sessions, and then 'Log out' of all sessions. 
 2. Reboot Quest. 
 3. Log into the mobile phone application. 
 4. Reboot Quest again. 
 
 All of your applications should show back up now.

problems.select_description: Can't sign in / Forgot lock pattern/pin

embed.title: Account issues
embed.description:
If you are unable to either sign in to your Quest/mobile app, or you have forgotten your pin information, please reach out to Oculus Support. 

 You can try contacting Oculus Support via either a ticket or live chat [here](https://tickets.oculusvr.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). 
If live chat is available, it will show up in the bottom right-hand corner.

problems.select_title: Air Link missing from PC app

embed.title: Air Link option missing
embed.description:
Air Link is no longer an option in the PC app as of V37.
 It is now automatic and is not required on the PC side; just enable it on your Quest and enjoy.

problems.select_description: Can't make a payment or add a card.

embed.title: Payment issues
embed.description:
Please reach out to Oculus Support. 

 You can try contacting Oculus Support via either a ticket or live chat [here](https://tickets.oculusvr.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). 
If live chat is available, it will show up in the bottom right hand corner.
 The community cannot help with this.

embed.title: Joystick drift
embed.description:
Joystick drift is a hardware failure that requires a new controller to fix.
 Please reach out to [Oculus Support](https://tickets.oculusvr.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) as this is not something the community can help with.

embed.title: 3 Dots
embed.description: The '3 dots' and DisplayPort not connected issues are fairly common and caused by a few things:

fields.name: Cable Issues / USB Issues
fields.value:
When you run into this issue, unplug your Rift from the GPU, but not USB, and then try plugging it back into the GPU. 
 If that doesn't help, try doing the opposite (unplugging the USB but not the cable to the GPU). 
 If you still have no luck, try to reseat the connector from the cable into the headset.

fields.name: Windows Issues
fields.value:
If nothing with the cable helped, we can look at Windows. 
 Make sure [USB suspend](https://venturebeat.com/2019/05/26/oculus-rift-s-how-to-fix-tracking-problems-and-blackouts/) is turned off. 
 Make sure your GPU Drivers are up to date.
 If you are using an Inateck PCIe card, uninstall the drivers and let Windows download the normal ones.

fields.name: Still not working
fields.value: Unfortunately, the Rift S is fairly prone to this issue; please post your system specs below as well as what you have tried.

embed.title: No Audio
embed.description:
If you are missing audio in one ear, it's likely an internal failure. 
 Unfortunately, the CV1 is prone to having the ribbon cable fail at one point or another. There are fixes like [this], however.
 If you are missing audio in both ears, make sure your audio device is set to the correct Oculus device, not the Virtual Audio Device.

index.name: Valve Index
index.select_description: We're still waiting for an index 2.0 :(
index.description: We're still waiting for an index 2.0 :(

embed.title: Headset not tracking
embed.description:
If you are currently seeing only a gray screen when putting your headset on, please check the following: 

 1. Your base stations are powered on. 
 2. Your base stations are showing green lights (if they are any other color, they could be asleep). 
 3. Your base stations show in SteamVR correctly.

 Please list your specs below if you still need help.

vive.name: HTC Vive
vive.select_description: Vive, Vive Pro, Cosmos, and Vive Focus
vive.description: Vive, Vive Pro, Cosmos, and Vive Focus

embed.title: Headset not tracking
embed.description:
If you are currently seeing only a gray screen when putting your headset on, please check the following: 

 1. Your base stations are powered on. 
 2. Your base stations are showing green lights (if they are any other color, they could be asleep). 
 Your base stations show in SteamVR correctly.

 Please list your specs below if you still need help.

problems.title: Floor Height
problems.solution:
If you find your floor height to be too low or high in WMR, hit the 'Start' option on your controllers. 
Go to 'All apps' and then select 'Room adjustment'. 
You can do this with or without controllers.

problems.title: Stuttering Issues
problems.solution: Please make sure 'HDR' and 'Hardware-accelerated GPU scheduling' are both disabled.

General Advice.name: Tech Advice
General Advice.select_description: Select me for general PC and tech advice
General Advice.description: For general PC and tech advice

problems.select_description: Advice on a new computer purchase
problems.title: Looking for advice on a new desktop or laptop
problems.solution:
If you're looking for a new computer, please make sure to list your budget, region, and anything specific you are looking for (such as what headset you are trying to run).
 All minor details can help with this process.

problems.select_description: Need help with my PC having issues unrelated to VR
problems.title: PC Help
problems.solution:
Please list your entire issue as well as any system specs that may be relevant. 
 Remember to include any details, no matter how minor.

problems.select_description: Looking to buy a new headset

embed.title: Headset Buying Guide
embed.description:
If you are just getting into VR and unsure what to buy, many community members have gone through the same thing and like to help others.
You can help anyone who wants to help you by providing the following information.

fields.name: Specs
fields.value:
Your PC specs, including CPU, GPU, RAM, Windows 10 or 11, if it's a laptop or desktop, and anything else you can think of. 
If you don't have a PC, that's fine as well! (Please mention it, however.)

fields.name: Budget
fields.value: Your budget, and what region that budget is for, as prices do vary between regions.

fields.name: Features
fields.value:
Are you looking for wireless? 
Do you need lighthouse tracking or inside out?
